relative 	Valentinianus Flavius, 	Ocellina,		Leontius Flavius,	Aulus Flavius,	Caius Flavius,	Cassius Flavius,	end
relative 	Leontius Flavius, 	Domitia,		Marcus Flavius,	Nero Flavius,	Oppius Flavius,	Placus Flavius,	end

faction	empire_east_rebels, religious_smith
dead_until_resurrected
re_emergent

faction	empire_west_rebels, fortified_stalin

	plan_set default_set
	faction_creator berbers
	building
	{
		type core_building governors_house
	}
	building
	{
		type barracks muster_field
	}
}

settlement
{
	level town
	region Locus_Melanogaetuli

	year_founded 363
	population 1000
	plan_set default_set
	faction_creator berbers
	building
	{
		type core_building governors_house
	}
}

;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
; >>>> start of regions section <<<<


;;define spawning scripts

;;if it's a settlement capture, use this script
;;(no point handling revolt because in base BI there's no way to revolt away from the roman empire)
spawn_script romano_british, capture, spawn_scripts/romano_british_spawn_script_capture.txt

;;if it's an end-of-turn event, use a separate script that's exclusively for the player spawning
spawn_script romano_british, end_of_turn, spawn_scripts/romano_british_spawn_script_end_of_turn.txt

;;handle the ostrogoths this way too, having them as a shadow faction is a lil weird
;;spawn_script ostrogoths, revolt, spawn_scripts/ostrogoths_spawn_script_revolt.txt

;;additional guard, very very rarely the goths don't take a settlement, so automatically spawn them as horde on turn 3 if that happens
;;spawn_script ostrogoths, end_of_turn, spawn_scripts/ostrogoths_spawn_script_end_of_turn.txt

;;handle scripted rebellions for letting the player spawn
script 
scripted_rebellion_script.txt, once_only
